loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus, a 36-year-old M-Pesa (mobile money transfer) operator in Magongo, Mombasa, is a married father of one who supports three people in his family; his spouse earns additional income. Cosmus has been in this business for the last three years and has done very well.

This will mark his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase a motorcycle for his new venture. Cosmus will use the anticipated profit to pay his loan and increase his M-Pesa float. He hopes to own several motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his second venture.

loans.name: Paulo Rosi

texts.es:
Paulo es un hombre de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposas, a quien ama y agradece su apoyo, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Paulo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Estofado de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Paulo trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Paulo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena, ladrillos y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para avanzar la construcción de su vivienda y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea cumplir su gran sueño de tener una gran familia.
texts.en:
Paulo is 31 years old and lives in with his wife in Pisco.  He loves her and is grateful for her support.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to getting ahead.  Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and out of necessity, he had to go to work when he was very young and was not able to study for a professional career in agriculture.  He likes to watch movies in his spare time and at times likes to prepare a delicious Estofado de Pollo dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much dedication and effort, Paulo works as a field hand in town.  He works about ten hours daily and believes that things are going well for her because of his dedication and friendliness towards others.

Paul is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help he will be able to buy building materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and other things which he will use to continue building his home.  He wants to complete his greatest dream of having a great family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman with three children, who all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a food kiosk, selling household consumables (wheat flour, maize flour and sugar). She sells at the market to her local neighbours. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

Patience has decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a small-scale food vendor. She cooks maize porridge for sale in Assiekie (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a primary school level graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver.  Rita has been working as a food vendor for close to six years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

Rita plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize and other ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. In the future, she hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize and other ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands.

loans.name: Rajashree-B Group

texts.en: Premlata is a 50-year-old married woman from the town of Bhawanipatna of Kalahandi District, Odisha, India. The lady standing on the extreme left with a raised hand is Premlata. She lives with her six-member family consisting of her husband; two sons, ages 25 and 22; and two daughters of 20 and 14 years of age. She is a very kindhearted, hardworking and enthusiastic women who always makes efforts to get her family ahead. Premlata has been running a general grocery shop for 12 years. Initially she started the business with a low profile selling limited items like potatoes, soap, sugar, tea dust, tobacco, chocolates, etc. Gradually she expanded her business and added extra items regularly. Due to her good behavior, her business grew very fast. In the year 2010, with her able leadership, Premlata along with four other women of her locality formed a joint liability group named Rajashree-B to take out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. All members hail from a poor background in the "below poverty line" category. This is the third loan for her group. With the last three loans, Premlata has been able to add some grocery items like dough, vegetables, oil and spices. Every day from the early morning, she starts her work for a stretch of ten hours. Now she is earning 500 Indian rupees daily from her business – which is not sufficient for her to manage the business. Premlata is planning to diversify her business by adding some daily needs food items. So, with the present loan, she has planned to buy biscuits, mixture, cake, bread, cold drinks, etc., in bulk. She also wants to purchase a refrigerator for storing the food items. She expects to increase her sales and income, which will serve to ensure the education and welfare of her children. Premlata hopes to build a house and get her children married into respectable families. The other four members of the group; Sasmita, Kumudini, Rohini and Soudamini, are running a betel nut shop, running a restaurant, selling vegetables wholesale and running a cloth store business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing biscuits, cake, bread, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nitaigour Group

texts.en:
Sanjukta, the lady standing on the extreme right with a smiling face in the photo, is a married woman of 33 years old. She lives in M.Rampur village of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India with her husband, one son of seven years and a daughter of four years. Both of her children are continuing their studies in her village. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates paddy (rice), black gram (lentils), and green gram on two hectares of farmland which is the primary source of income of her family.

To add more income to the family, Sanjukta has also been running a dry foods selling business for last 10 years. To set up her business in the year 2009, Sanjukta formed a joint liability group of six members named Nitaigour by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. In the meantime the group of Sanjukta has accessed a loan thrice and has successfully developed their businesses. 

This time Sanjukta has taken a top-up loan of 2,400 INR to purchase a cook stove being promoted by Mahashakti Foundation. The salient features of this cook stove are that it is smokeless, fuel saving up to 50% and time saving which will indirectly help for the protection of the environment.  Sanjukta thinks this product will be very helpful for her to provide extra time for her business and save some money. Sanjukta hopes to give better education to her children.

With the motivation of Sanjukta the other five members of her group named Mahima, Bilasini, Damani, Harapriya and Usha have also purchased one cook stove each from the present loan.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a cook stove

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is married and has five children. Although she has received no formal education, she is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Assiekie (near Takoradi) and has been involved in this enterprise for three years. 
 
Faustina’s husband works as a contractor. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 
 
Faustina wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.  In the long term, Faustina plans to reinvest future profits into her business to expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Eima

texts.en:
Elna is a married mother of one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rented house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rental bills.

For more than one year, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: After graduating primary school class six, Mary decided to set up her own fish vending business in Assiekie (near  Takoradi). With more than ten years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, her ability to do so is limited, due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more fish for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a trader) with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 58 years old and widowed. She was blessed with seven children, and the family lives happily in a rural community. Despite the hardships, Pilar is determined to uplift her family’s status of living to give her children a better life. 

Pilar engages in raising hogs to generate additional income. She had planned to raise more pigs to sell but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed to raise hogs. 

Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy the feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: After graduating Junior high school,   Sophia decided to set up her own dress-making  business in Assiekie  (near Cape Coast). With over two years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited, due to a lack of funds. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase an additional sewing machine to make her work easier. She aims at using the profits from her business to help her husband with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their only child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: purchase an additional sewing machine to make her work easier

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Ms Nasra is 26 years old and is a married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for seven years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her excellent services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. However, because she has little cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of PKK 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater for more customers time after time. With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products but will also able to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Maha Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Sebati is a housewife aged 28 who lives with her husband and one son of three years in a rural village named Salepali in Kalahandi district of Odisha state in India. The lady standing on the extreme left with an orange-colored sari is Sebati. Sebati is running leaf plate manufacturing and dry food businesses and her husband works as a carpenter. He also cultivates paddy (rice), maize and vegetables. From the above Sebati’s family get a monthly income of 4000 INR which makes it very difficult to manage her family's budget. 

The village Salepali is very remotely located and people depend on the nearby town for all things. 98% of households in this village use fuel wood for cooking purposes. In the present situation it is very hard and expensive to get fuel wood. So the people of this area are wasting their time, money and energy to obtain it.

When Mahashakti Foundation introduced its cook stove loans, a demonstration meeting was organized in this village. In the meeting the usefulness of the cook stove--less smoke, fuel saving, less fuel cost up to 50% and time saving points--were discussed which impressed people. To get this loan Sebati formed a Joint Liability Group named Maha Laxmi, taking three other like-minded women of her village  as members. 

From this loan Sebati is planning to purchase a cook stove which costs Rs.2400/- . She thinks that this smokeless stove will help to save fuel wood, save time, and protect her from the bad effects of smoke. This also indirectly supports environment protection. She hopes it will also help to develop her current business so she can earn more income for better living. 

The other three members of the group are Labanya, Sumani and Sumitra.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a cook stove

loans.name: Fateh

texts.en: Ms. Fateh is a 56-year-old energetic married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business of cattle rearing. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then sells them out in the market for a higher price. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase another cow. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 39 years old, comes from Nyahururu, and is happy that her farm is doing well after the previous loan from KADET LTD. She was able to buy fertilizers and herbicides that she used and was able to get a good harvest.

Cecilia has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a dairy cow which she will use to produce milk to sell to neighboring shops. She is optimistic that her business will do well after the loan.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a  dairy cow

loans.name: Faton

texts.en:
Faton  is a thirty-two-year-old and married. He  has one daughter and they all live in the southern part of Kosovo. They are very poor. He owns a small old house that is need of renovation and has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. The current main source of income comes from him; he is working in a bowling alley with a very low salary. 

Faton's house has an insulation problem; it loses a lot of heat. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy the coal to keep the house warm. His family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter due to the lack of heat. Faton needs a loan to renovate his house. Renovation in this manner will allow his family to live a normal and healthy life. He really appreciates this help!

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in baking bread for sale in Assiekie (near the Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years.  Mary is married and has 4 children.  Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.  Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of flour and sugar, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bread. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase greater quantities of flour and sugar to bake her bread .

loans.name: Anabela

texts.en: Anabela is taking a loan of $ 1 000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) and she is married. Her husband works as a businessman. She has a shop to generate income for her family. Her husband takes care of animals such as buffalo, pigs and chickens, as  well as having land for fields. She wants to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second hand clothes, shoes and bags.She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, shoes and  bags for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Due to hardships in living, Maria buys and sells charcoal and frozen foods in her community to earn additional income. She is 56 years old and has three adult-age children. She aims to strengthen the business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional stock of charcoal and frozen foods to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to make more improvements in the business, and she is hoping that she will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Zenona

texts.en:
Zenona is a 58-year-old farmer from Sikatuna, Bohol. Zenona has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 20 years now. 

Zenona is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her business thus augmenting her income and earnings. In the future, Zenona hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Freeda

texts.en:
Ms Freeda is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a beauty parlor in her community for the last two and a half years.  She very well knows the art of makeup and hair styling and she makes enough to lead a decent life; her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the everyday expenditure of the house hold. 

In order to deal with more customers time after time she needs to purchase packs of makeup kits, hair rollers and facial creams. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She is hopeful that she will get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase packs of makeup kits, hair rollers and facial creams.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a lady of forty-six, married to Kahira and a mother of two children. She sells used clothes in Kangemi and has been in this business for five years now. She gets monthly income of KES 15,000.

This will be Hannah's first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy used clothes for selling. In future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children and in their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and herchildren’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family will have a good life. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Ms Haleema is a 46-year-old married woman; she has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Haleema’s husband. 

She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more goats. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
A $ 600 loan is offered to Ana to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of of $ 200. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like oil, slippers, noodles, soft drinks and biscuits. 

Ana is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy, oil, slippers, noodles, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 39-year-old food kiosk owner from Majaoni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three whose spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last five years and has done great.

This marks her second loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She will use her loan to purchase a dry food stock of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and cooking oil for her kiosk. 

The anticipated income will help her service her loan as well as take care of her children's school needs. She hopes to prosper in her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase a dry food stock of maize flour, wheat flour, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and a widow. She lives in a rural community with one of her sisters. To earn additional income, she is engaged in buying and selling fish sauces within their village. 

She aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of fish sauce and plastic containers to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish sauce and plastic containers.

loans.name: Hilda Consuelo

texts.es: Hilda, soplcita un nuevo prestamo, ya que los creditos son una fuente generadora de ingresos y porque requiere productos de primera necesidad para surtir una tienda que posee; este lo invertirá en la comprar de arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, churros, gaseosas, sardinas, jabón, entre otros productos. El credito anterior le ayudo a adquirir buenas ganancias y con ello logro tener variedad de productos en el negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda is requesting a new loan because the loans are a source of generating income.  Also, she needs basic needs products in order to stock the store that she has.

She will use the loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, churros, soft drinks, sardines, and soap, among other products.

The previous loan helped her to get good earnings with which she managed to have a variety of products in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, sugar, churros, soft drinks, sardines, and soap, among other products.

loans.name: May Maria

texts.en:
May Maria is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She has a stall where she sells variety of motor parts and bicycle parts. She is friendly and helpful woman and this causes her demand to increase.  People are looking for her products because she offers very affordable prices with high quality.  She wants to grow her business, finish educating her children, and improve their living situation. 

To smoothly achieve her dreams, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 pesos to purchase motor parts, auto supply items, and bicycle parts as additional products to offer. She is determined to be successful, with industriously working at her business everyday. With that and faith in God, she believes she will soon  achieve financial stability and a comfortable quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts, auto supply items and bicycle parts

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en: Ms. Chanda is a 25-year-old married lady. She is providing makeup services to the people of her community. She knows very well the techniques of makeup and earns enough to contribute to the family income. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics. But, because of having low cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of 15,000 Pakistani rupees to buy packs of lipsticks, makeup kits and nail polishes. She is hoping to serve more customers after some time, which will ultimately help generate more income. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy packs of lipsticks, makeup kits and nail polishes.

loans.name: Hajrije

texts.en: Hajrije is 57 years old, and the married mother of six children. She lives in a minority community as a housewife, taking care of children. Her husband works as a taxi driver with a very low salary. Hajrije owns a small, old house that is need of renovation and has not had any repairs or renovations in the past several years. Her house has an insulation problem, in which it loses much heat. Every winter, it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep the house warm. Hajrije’s family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter, due to the lack of heat. She needs a loan to renovate her house to buy building materials to finish the renovation. Renovation in this manner will allow her family to live a normal and healthy life. She really appreciates this help!

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to renovate her house.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is 49 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with his wife and two sons. Ilia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is his wife's small monthly salary from her work as a cook at a local restaurant. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ilia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Ilia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Ilia will start a condensed milk production business. He will purchase all the needed equipment and raw materials for producing condensed milk. He will also provide a supply of the product to local markets. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a condensed milk production business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 24 years old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with her 36-year-old husband. Anna requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Anna has her own business. She is trading second-hand clothes. She is renting a small commercial space, purchases clothes at a wholesale price and sells them from her shop with a price mark-up to earn a small monthly income.

Anna requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Anna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Anna will purchase a stock of second hand clothes for her shop. She wants to expand the business and have a better choice to offer to the clients. As Anna is already experienced in this field, she knows what type of clothes to buy and what is more consumable. This will increase the numbers of clients and sales so Anna will have more profit. Part of the profit she will use for reinvesting in her business and another part for covering the family's monthly expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of second hand clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano is a married man and a father of five children from Loon, Bohol. Cayetano has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. 

Cayetano is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feeds for the pigs. With this, he will be able to improve his hog-raising venture thus augmenting his income and savings. In the future, Cayetano dreams of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Ms. Naziran is a 43-year-old married woman who has been in the work of sweater-weaving for almost four years. She works hard on her weaving every day so she may earn a living for her family. She has four children, two sons and two daughters. There were days when her husband could not find work and had to return home without any money. His heart was heavy with the burden of facing his family’s disappointed faces. Her children often slept without having any food. 

When Kashf’s loan officers found her in these circumstances, they informed her about microfinance and the facilities they had to offer. The couple decided to take a loan so she could start her work. She said she remembered doing it with her mother in her childhood and was hopeful that the work would help them fight poverty. 

Currently she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase spools of wool and thread in different colors for weaving. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf, she said her children have never had to go to sleep without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spools of wool and thread in  different colors for weaving.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is a 61-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown-up children from Loon, Bohol. Nemesia has had a sewing and dressmaking business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Nemesia is asking for a loan to buy materials for sewing like cloth, needles, thread and other items. With this, she will be able to sew more clothing and other things; thus, augmenting her income and savings. Nemesia hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing like cloth, needles, thread and others

loans.name: Batzorigt

texts.en: Mr. Batzorigt is 47 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and son in Kherlen, Mongolia. His wife is a butcher and sells mutton and beef at the market. His daughter works as a barkeeper in a pub. His son goes to high school. He himself has been transporting goods within his home town and finds his customers at the market. Before the transportation business, he had been working at a military base. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay the rental fee for a karaoke operation. As a result, he can generate more income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to pay the rental fee for a karaoke operation.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is applying for a loan of $1,200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as oil, sugar, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, and cigarettes. She is making good money from selling these items and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future.
Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy items, including students.

loans.use: to buy noodles, soft drinks, biscuits, cigarettes, and other items to stock in her store.

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhbat, 43 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has been rendering taxi service to local people using his automobile since 2004. She herself is a hairdresser at a barbershop. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase an electric car. This electric car will be used by her son for taxi service as a income generator. 

More importantly, an electric car releases no air pollutants at all and wastes less fuel. Using this electric car will  certainly contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car

loans.name: Dúo Xejul Group

texts.es: Dúo Xejul, este dúo esta integrado por la señora Aura Cristina, de 41 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, ya que es de esa forma como ella apoya a su familia para tener un futuro mejor, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos para la venta, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Aura Cristina is a member of this duo, Dúo Xejul.  She is forty-one years old and makes a living making typical woven items.  She has been dedicated to this activity for several years.  In this way, she can support her family in having a better future. 

She is requesting this loan to buy raw material to make typical woven items to sell.  She hopes that individuals can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make typical woven items to sell.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es una mujer de 64 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Basilia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pure con Bisteck para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, Basilia se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra pallar y algodón, Basilia trabaja en ella todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia.
Basilia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda  brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y cubrirá los gastos de riego de su cultivo de pallar, de esta manera Basilia podrá obtener una buena cosecha, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una casa segura que brinde mayor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Basilia is 64 years old and lives in the city of Nazca, along with her husband and four children, whom she loves and are her main reasons for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts, along with her husband, toward getting their family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, she had to go to work when she was very young and was not able to study for a professional career.  She likes to watch TV in her spare time and at times likes to cook a Pure con Bistek dish to share with her family.  With great effort, dedication, and with the skills her parents taught her, Basilia farms and has a small parcel where she raises lima beans and cotton.  She works the fields for about 10 hours a day and is able to do the job well, thanks to her experience.  

Basilina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to their help she will be able to buy fertilizer and cover the cost of irrigating her lima bean crop.  In this way Basilia will be able to obtain a good harvest and be able to continue working and making an effort to achieve her dream of a secure home and better wellbeing for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Eshun is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Assiekie (which is near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for  three  years.  Philomina  is married and has 3 children.  Her husband works as a contractor. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Philomina  wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Philomina plans to reinvest future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Maritess engages in raising fingerlings while her husband cultivates their farmland. She is 40 years old and has three school-age children. They aimed to increase their production and income in order to satisfy their necessities and continue sending their children to school. They want them to earn a degree so that they will be able to find a good job someday. To meet these needs, Maritess plans to raise more fingerlings to sell. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000to buy feeds and additional fingerlings. She is hoping that her loan will be a great help to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional fingerlings to raise.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms Shazia is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been running a clothes-selling business for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the city and then sells them to the people in her local community, where she has become famous for selling good quality clothing. 

Shazia has requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. Shazia hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a 56-year-old widowed landlady in Mikindani, Mombasa, has been in this business for the last 13 years and has done very well. A mother and the sole supporter of two children in college and two in high school, Joyce has requested her fifth loan from KADET LTD to pay tuition for her daughter at the university.

Joyce hopes to continue getting funds from KADET to put up kiosks on her other UN-developed land in Mikindani in the future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Ibbett Del Carmen

texts.es: Ibbett, es una señora casada, madre de un hijo de 4 años de edad, el esposo trabaja en informática y ella en servicios de costura por su propia cuenta desde hace 5 años, con sus ingresos paga los gastos del hogar, la manutención de su hijo y la escuela. Con esta primer experiencia de crédito con Afodenic desea construir el muro perimetral de su vivienda para evitar que el agua de la calle se meta en tiempos de lluvia, ya que es una calle de tierra y se inunda todo por la falta de un muro de concreto y es perjudicial para la salud de la familia.
texts.en:
Ibbett is a married woman and is the mother of one son, who is four years old.  Her husband works in information technology and she has worked in offering tailoring services through her own account for five years.  With her income, she pays the home expenses and for the care and schooling of her son.  

This is her first loan experience with Afodenic and she wishes to construct a perimeter wall around her home to prevent the water in the street from entering her home in the rainy season.  The street is a dirt road and everything floods due to the lack of a concrete wall; it is detrimental to the health of her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron bars, blocks, and gravel.

loans.name: Baatarsukh

texts.en: Baatarsukh, 37, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Baatarsukh has been working as a carpenter since 1993, and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. His wife is unemployed and assists his business. He makes various types of products, such as furniture, dishes, vases and shelves. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repairs, so he is requesting a loan of 5,300,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, fiberglass, foam and gypsum walls. Using those materials, he can repair and insulate his house, thus enabling his family to live in a comfortable and warm place.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, fiberglass, foam and gypsum walls.

loans.name: Buena Lyn

texts.en:
For the past year Buena Lyn, 48 years of age, has operated a stall selling a variety of plastic wares in the market. Because she wants to boost her income to improve her family's poor living standards, Buena Lyn is requesting a loan of P 20,000 to buy a greater variety of plastic wares such as plates and tumblers to offer for sale.

She hopes this measure will lead to higher sales and income. Hopefully she can improve her business and expand further in the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of plastic wares such as plates and tumblers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 33 years old. For the last nine years, he has earned a living by offering computer services in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of about 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from the business. 

Mathias was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for his fourth loan of 91,100 KES to buy additional computer equipment and a motorcycle.

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his nephew and niece as well as continue expanding the businesses. His goal for the future is to continue growing the businesses so that he may improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional computer equipment and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en: Anecito is a 23-year-old married man from the town of Antequera on Bohol in the Philippines. He has had a basket-weaving business for more than four years now, which is the source of his income. Anecito is requesting a loan to buy wicker, buri "native palm" and straw. With this, he will be able to weave more baskets and sell them at the market. In the future, Anecito hopes of improving his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy wicker, buri and straw for weaving baskets

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a widow and has two children. After successfully graduating primary school, Cecilia is now an established businesswoman. She sells clothes in Asiekie (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about eight years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Cecelia uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Antequera, Bohol. Berlinda has been engaged in a basket-weaving business for more than 23 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Berlinda is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving like nito, buri ("native palm") and wicker. Through this loan, she will be able to weave more, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Berlinda dreams of expanding her ventures in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving like nito, buri and wicker.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is a fish vendor from the town of Maribojoc on Bohol, the Philippines. She is a married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband works as a carpenter. Apolonia is asking for a loan to buy more fish stocks. With this, she will be able to increase her sales to the people in her community, thus boosting her income. In the future, Apolonia hopes to make her business a sustainable success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul still operates an agrovet shop and sells farm supplies to his clients in Malindi for a living. He earns a monthly income of about 10,170 KES (Kenyan shillings). The loan of 70,000 KES given to Paul will allow him to purchase additional stock such as fertilizer, seeds and farm sprays. 

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. Paul intends to continue growing his business and hopes that one day, he will come to own a well-established agrovet wholesale shop in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as fertilizer, seeds and farm sprays.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stck his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of three members; two women and a man. The Teshie community is located in the coastal region of Accra. The members are traders seeking opportunities at every moment to get ahead and, through their daily efforts, to provide a better future for their children. The main economic activities of the partners are selling of jeans, foodstuffs and electrical appliances.

Elizabeth was born in the community of Teshie and lives in the same community where she was born. She is 41 years old, divorced and has two children. Her main economic activity is selling jeans and wigs. She has a little shop at home where she operates her business. At this time, she is requesting a loan of 2,000 cedis to improve her business.

Elizabeth, Veronica and Kwame together need 3,000 cedis to buy enough commodities to serve customers better.

loans.use: to buy enough jeans and wigs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 43 years old. She lives in the small village of Tsageri District with her parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. Irma requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly retirement pension of her parents. It totals 220 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irma requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Irma has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Irma will begin a trade in clothing and bedclothes. She plans to purchase clothing and bedclothes in Turkey and then resell them among her villagers at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin a trade in clothing and bedclothes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, a widowed mother of two children, operates a provisions shop in Asiekie (near Takoradi). As the sole breadwinner in the family, Doris uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Doris will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thereby helping her to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, Doris understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thereby helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is a 51-year-old married woman and a resident of the town of Antequera, Bohol. Ceferina is the mother of three children. Ceferina, together with her husband, has been engaged in a furniture making business for more than 10 years now. This is their way of earning an income.

Ceferina is asking for a loan to buy wood, lumber, varnish and nails. With this, they will be able to improve their furniture business and serve more customers in their shop. In the future, Ceferina is hopeful that she will be able to expand their business and income.

loans.use: to buy wood, lumber, varnish and nails for her furniture making business

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en: Biasha thanks Kiva for the previous loan that helped her to boost her business. She again comes to you for another loan of 10,000 KES to enable her to pay school fees for her children and also do shopping for them. She aspires to expand her existing business in the future.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children and also do shopping for them

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 34 years old, married and a mother of three children. She operates a cafe in Malindi for a living where she earns a monthly profit of about 6,390 KES. 

Annah was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she has applied for a loan of 60,000 KES. This will allow Annah to purchase the additional stock and items such as serving plates, tea cups, water jugs, sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and cooking flour. 

She will use the anticipated profits to help pay school fees for her children. Annah intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own a well-established hotel in the area.

loans.use: to buy serving plates, tea cups, water jugs, sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and cooking flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Rosa Elida

texts.es: rosa de 33 años de edad vive con su hijo y su esposo en casa propia ella tiene un negocio de venta de sandalias de diferentes estilos, tallas y colores para mujeres, niños y hombres su negocio tiene mas de 4 años de funcionar esta ubicada en un mercado cerca de donde reside tiene mucha clientela pues da su mercaderia a un buen precio, ella solicita un credito para poder surtir mas su negocio pues ha tenido muy buena demanda y asi con las ganacias que obtenga podra darle a su familia una mejor estabiliadad economica.
texts.en: Rosa is 33 years old and lives with her son and husband in a home of her own.  She has a business where she sells sandals of various styles, sizes, and colors for men, women, and children.  She has had this business for more than four years and it’s located in a market near her home.  She has many customers because her products are of good prices.  She is asking for a loan in order to stock her business.  She has had a good demand and will be able to provide better financial stability to her family with her earnings.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace  is married with 3 children. She has received some schooling through the end of junior high school. Currently, Grace sells clothing and footwear in Asiekie (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about 3 years now. Her husband is a driver. Grace's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Grace will use the loan to increase her existing clothing and footwear capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Grace plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: increase her existing clothing and footwear capacity

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 50 years old, married with three children. He has 30 years of experience in running a grocery store. He usually sells daily products in the store such as tea, sugar, rice, candy, sauces, beans and other food items. His wife helps him to sell products.

Kamil`s store is located in a bazaar. There are daily customers who come to purchase the items they need. His monthly income from the business is 150 AZN. The revenue he gets from the store takes care of his children and also supports his relatives, financially. He is the person who always works hard in order to achieve more.

Kamil has taken a loan before Aqroinvest. He has applied for a fifth loan of 2,000 AZN. With this money he plans to purchase more products and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 43-year-old widow and she has two children ages 16 and 14 years old. She has been selling rice for a period of about five years with an income of approximately 40,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she will use the loan to buy more rice in bulk for sale. She hopes to be the best rice supplier in the area and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy more rice in bulk for sale

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is a small-scale food vendor; she fries yam and fish for sale in Asekie (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a primary school level graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Dora has been working as a food vendor for close to 15 years. 

As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of yams, fish and other ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of starting a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of yams, fish and, other ingredients, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a small-scale food vendor. She fries yam and fish for sale in Assiekie, near Takoradi. She has had some form of formal education, as she is a primary school graduate. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a driver.

Comfort has been working as a food vendor for close to four years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of yam, fish and other ingredients; thus, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a food stand; hence, helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of yam, fish and other ingredients; thus, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Boditsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Boditsetseg, 24 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Last year the couple purchased a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling), and now they are living in it. She rents a stall where she has sold juices and vegetables to local people since 2011. Before owning her business, she was working as a saleswoman at a vegetable sales stall. Since 2011, the price of vegetables and fruits reached its maximum level, and the demand for those products increased drastically. So she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy vegetables and fruits in large volume from China. As a result, she can continue to sell vegetables and fruits without worrying about inventory shortages. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits from China in large volume for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is married to a sprayer. She has four children. She uses her income to help her husband pay household expenses, and to save for a rainy day. A junior high school graduate, Veronica currently sells yam tubers in Asekie (near Takoradi). With over four years of experience in this trade, Veronica sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise, but she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her stock. Her loan will be used to buy more yam tubers, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Veronica wants to make her business self-sustaining as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her yam enterprise.

loans.use: buy more yam tubers, indirectly helping her to boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en: Fidela is a dressmaker from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four grown children. Fidela has been in the dressmaking business for more than 30 years. This is the source of her income. Fidela is asking for a loan to buy materials for dressmaking, such as cloth, garters, zippers, buttons, thread and needles. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for dressmaking, such as cloth, garters, zippers, buttons, thread and needles.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is married and has four children. She received some schooling, through junior high school. Currently, Adowa sells yam tubers in Asiekie (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this business for some years. Her husband is a contractor.  Adwoa’s  income goes toward helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  Adwoa will use the loan to increase her existing stock of yam tubers. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Adwoa plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to increase her stock of yam tubers to sell.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 52 years old. He lives in the village of Dzevera, Gori district. Paata requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Paata is an artisan. He is working for private orders in construction and on house renovations to get a small monthly salary. This is the only income for Paata, and it's not enough to cover his monthly expenses.

Paata requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Paata has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Paata will purchase maize, haricot and tomato seeds and fertilizer. As he already owns an agricultural plot of land, Paata wants to cultivate it and plant all the products. The fertilizer will help him to get a good harvest, which will be sold locally at the markets. Part of the profit will be used in the same field, in order to expand his agricultural business. Paata’s income will significantly increase, and he will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase maize, haricot and tomato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than two years now. She is married woman with three children from Panglao, Bohol. Juliet is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and profit. In the future, Juliet dreams of making her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is 57 years old and is married with four children. She sells food products, such as macaronis, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies, and beverages in her shop. Bahar has 24 years of experience in this field, which makes her a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food product she sells is very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 120 AZN. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location in the central bazaar of her home city. 

The profit she gains is not enough to reinvest into the business and covering customers` demands is impossible for this reason. Since this is her main source of income, her profit is used for family needs. Bahar would like to increase her sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose she applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. She will purchase and diversify the foodstuffs she sells. This will be her fourth loan, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to increase revenue

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en: Ma. Cecelia runs a food vending business in her place in Panglao, Bohol. Ma. Cecelia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings. With this, she will be able to cook more and sell more thus increasing her income and profit. In the future, Ma. Cecelia hopes to expand her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, cooking oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education,  Rebecca  is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Asekie (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years.   

Rebecca is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Rebecca wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Rebecca plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

loans.name: Mirzakul

texts.en:
Mirzakul is 57 years old, married with three children. Being a responsible father, Mirzakul works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs.  He is dedicated to a farming business, growing rice, potatoes, carrots and wheat on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards he has worked hard from early morning till late evening for years.

Mirzakul would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 7,500 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. 

He hopes that Kiva lenders won’t reject his loan and he thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde earns a living through her motorcycle transport business and basket weaving. She lives with her family in Antequera, Bohol. Matilde is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance for the motorcycle and materials for basket weaving like buri, wicker, and other materials. Matilde hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance for her motorcycle and materials for basket weaving

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is divorced and has six children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Agnes is a successful businesswoman. She cooks rice and vegetable sauce for sale in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Agnes uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Agnes will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business,  Agnes plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice, fish and other ingredients  to prepare her food.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of candle-making and has been in this business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more raw materials to make candles. She generates additional income from working as a records assistant. She works in a shop that she rents and sells on both wholesale and retail basis. She works six days out of every week. Her major business challenge include seasonality and thieves.  

She is aspiring to sell only by wholesale and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make candles.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married with three children. She has received some schooling til the end of junior high school. Currently, Georgina sells cooking utensils in Hotopo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about three years now. Her husband is in the construction industry. Georgina's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Georgina will use the loan to increase her existing cooking utensils supply. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Georgina plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing cooking utensils inventory.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
This is Felicitas, 48, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a local official, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Felicitas operates a printing business. She mainly offers signboards, sticker boards, tarpaulins and other printed materials used in business establishments, schools and other similar places. They buy materials and supplies to use for their printing and to manufacture different printed materials their customers require. Her regular customers are business owners, students and the local community. She makes at least PHP 1,000 in sales every day. To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy materials needed in printing, such as ink, polyester, plastic and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Felicitas hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed in printing, such as ink, polyester, plastic and other materials.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a business management student of the Maharishi Institute. Jacob is 23 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“I study at the Maharishi Institute because it mainly deals with human development, reaching my full potential. I enjoy the daily TM (Transcendental Meditation) and Sidi-program (Advanced Techniques) and currently I enjoy the economics class. Algebra is also my favourite.”

What are your goals after graduation?
“After graduation, I would love to work as a financial analyst and work at the Johannesburg Stock Exchange. A couple of years thereafter, I would like to open my own consulting company. I would love to work in London, UK, but my heart will always remain in Africa, where I’d also open offices around the continent in order to play in the development of Africa’s wealth.”

Tell us about your background?
“I was born in Tembisa and grew up in Johannesburg all my life. I have a 34-year-old brother. My mother works as a domestic worker and I have been living with her as a single parent. My father works as a mechanic, but he hasn't played a huge role in my life until recently, when he has shown initiative and added some support. I am grateful for both my parents. I have a 3-year-old beautiful daughter who currently lives with her grandparents in Limpopo and, as a young father, I want a better life for myself so that she also can have a better future.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“I like collecting books. I read motivational books, business books as well as spiritual books. I also play lots of sports, mainly soccer and cricket.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?
"It will help me achieve my goal of graduating and help me with having no financial burden after graduating, since I will be repaying the loan at a reasonable rate. It will also help me with travelling expenses – meaning there will be no excuses for me not going to school.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a hardworking mother, who supports her husband in generating income for the sake of their family. She is now 49-years-old and has been gifted with five children. Due to financial constraints, she aims to improve her small variety store in order to satisfy her customer's demand and increase her income. She is requesting for a loan of P10,000.00 to buy rice, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, beverages, snack foods and seasonings to sell. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that she will able to improve her business someday through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, beverages, snack foods and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman with one daughter who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but without piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills. For over four years, she has operated a second hand clothes selling business, selling in a shop to both women and men. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in prices of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding her shop to earn more profits in the future. With the KES 50,000, she wants to buy bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet is single with two children. She is 45 years old and lives in Teshie, and she is the leader of Janet's group.

Janet has an assorted food joint where she cooks food like 'fufu' (pounded cassava), soup, 'Ampesi' (cooked yams or plantains), and stew. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of GHS 3,000 to be able to buy plenty of cassava, fish, vegetables, and other ingredients to cook food in commercial quantities and sell to customers.

This is her seventh loan from ID-Ghana.

Janet, together with Daniel, needs a total amount of GHS 3,700 to be able to serve customers better.

loans.use: to buy plenty of cassava, fish, vegetables and other ingredients to cook food in commercial quantities and sell to customers.

loans.name: Zanele

texts.en:
Zanele is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute. Zanele is 26 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“I am studying (for) a Bachelors of Business Administration. I enjoy English, Maths and Business Fundamentals classes.”

What are your goals after graduation?
“After graduating, I want to be a financial manager, and I also want to start my own transport company in the area where I grew up. I would like to work in Pretoria, and I would like to travel and see different places.”

Tell us about your background?
“I was born in Tweepoview, Mpumalanga. I have one sister and one brother, but we are also living with three cousins whose parents passed away. My mother is working in a clothing factory, and she is a breadwinner because my father passed away in 2009. I am not yet married, and I do not have any children.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“I spend time with my family, I read motivational books, and I also hairdress people to get myself pocket money.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?
“Kiva will change my life because I am coming from a poor family. My mother was struggling to pay for my studies and even to pay for my accommodation. So Kiva will help me to pay my tuition and also my living costs. This loan will not affect my studies and my lifestyle.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina is married with 4 children. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school. Currently, Helina sells provisions in Asiekie (which is near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 2 years now. Her husband is a contractor. Helina's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Helina will use the loan to increase her existing provision capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Lucy plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing provision capacity

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 62 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his wife and son. Vazha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Vazha is a hired worker at a local bread factory, making a total of 300 Laris (GEL) per month, which is the only source of income for the family. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vazha requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Vazha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.
