Ella está consciente y segura de que con el dinero que recibirá le irá muy bien, ya que podrá comprar chocolate galletas y moldes  y los insumos necesarios para vender pasteles y chocolates a algunos negocios que le han hecho pedidos y además están cerca de su hogar. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es la ayuda monetaria que otorgan, la confianza que tiene con los socios, la ayuda y el apoyo incondicional, además de incentivarlos para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y con su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela belongs to the Pulmón Verde communal bank located in Concepción, region VIII of Chile. In the photo, she appears standing up on the right side of the photo, smiling, and wearing a short-sleeved black top. At this bank, the members have various businesses such as selling kebabs, furniture, new and used clothing, undergarments, and pastries. 

Marcela works by selling pastries. She doesn't have an established location but she learned in order to move her son forward since it just the two of them and she needs income to give him a better lifestyle. She started by making pastries about three years ago and learned from reading recipes, cook books and cooking articles. The most difficult part is moving forward with little money, since she doesn't have enough money to set up a business with the equipment and bakery supplies that are necessary to work. This means that she doesn't have money to buy supplies or to eat. She is sure that with the money she will receive, she will do well because she will be able to buy chocolate cookies, molds, and the necessary supplies to sell pastries and chocolates to nearby businesses that have made orders. Her favorite parts of working with Fondo Esperanza are the monetary help they provide, the trust they have in the members, the help, and the unconditional support. She also likes that the communal bank encourages them to move forward in their businesses and with their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola de 36 años de edad ,esta casada con Daniel desde hace 07 años, tiene 02 hijos menores de 07 y 02 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia la cual logró construir con el apoyo incondicional  de su pareja.El trabajo que realiza Lola es la venta de materiales de construcción, accesorios, entre  otros, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa, se dedica  a ésta actividad desde hace 04 años  el cual inició con su esposo. Trabaja todo el día y sus ganancias al final del día son muy alentadoras y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite sustentar los gastos que se genera en su hogar, le ha permitido  pagar los estudios de sus hijos los cuales son su principal inspiración de seguir trabajando para darles una mejor calidad de vida, además le gusta porque no trabaja con productos perecibles lo que le permite almacenarlo sin ningún problema, tiene planes de seguir incrementado su negocio con más artículos y abrir otro local.Este es el crédito número 06 con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles comprará mercadería para su ferretería principalmente comprará tubos de conexión para agua y desagüe , clavos , fierros , entre otros y además complementará su negocio con la compra de triplay ya que sus clientes le exigen este producto.
texts.en:
Lola, 36, has been married to Daniel for seven years. They have two children, ages 7 and 2. They live in their own house, which she was able to build with the unconditional support of her husband. Lola sells building materials and supplies, among other items, from an air-conditioned space in her home. She started this business four years ago with her husband. She works all day, and her profits are encouraging. She is happy that her business generates money to pay her household expenses and to pay for her children's education. They are her main inspiration to keep working; she wants to provide them with a better life. The other good thing about her business is that her products are not perishable and are easily stored. 

Lola plans to stock more items and to open another location. This is her 6th loan cycle with Kiva. She thanks those who have made loans, as they have let her meet her goals. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan of  S/.2500 soles to buy merchandise for her hardware store: connecting water pipes and drains, nails, and metal bar. She will also buy plywood, a product her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy pipes, nails, metal bars, and more.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and sister). She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, fresh beans and cassava. She works at the market and sells on retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of food stuffs in Uganda. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, fresh beans and cassava.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz, y a la comercialización de ganado. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar el alquiler de un terreno para alimentar al ganado que comprar y engordarlo para su posterior venta. Con la inversión, tendrá un lugar para mantener seguros los animales y bien alimentados para engordarlos más rápido y venderlos a buen precio y obtener mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en: Pedro, 63, is married and has three children. For 20 years, he has grown corn and raised livestock. He has applied for a loan with Fundación Campo to rent grazing land for the livestock he raises and sells. With this investment, he will have a space to keep his animals safe and well fed. They will fatten faster and bring a good price at market, and Pedro will earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to rent grazing land for the livestock he raises and sells.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana, de 23 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijas de dos y cuatro años de edad, inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente tres años, se dedica a vender  bisutería  para dama tales como relojes, pinturas, collares, pulcesas,etc  y ropa interior, gracias a los créditos que fape y kiva le ha brindado, actualmente inicio un negocio de venta de ropa para toda la familia y sus ingresos han aumentado ella solicita un crédito para invertir la mayor parte en la venta de ropa y lo demás en la venta de bisutería, el sueño mas grande que ella tiene y le pide a Dios que sea a corto plazo es comprar un terreno para tener casa propia ya que donde ella vive la casa es familiar.
texts.en: 23-year-old Sebastiana is married and has two daughters, who are two and four years old. She began her business approximately three years ago, selling costume jewelry for ladies, such as watches, makeup, necklaces, bracelets, and more, in addition to underwear. Thanks to the loans given to her by FAPE and Kiva, she has started a business selling clothes for the whole family and her earnings have increased. She is requesting a loan in order to invest the majority of it in clothing sales and the rest in selling costume jewelry. Her greatest dream, which she asks God to fulfill soon, is to be able to buy a piece of land so she can have her own house as she currently lives in the family home.

loans.use: to sell ladies' clothing and to buy costume jewelry

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Don Marvin, un hombre casado su esposa es ama  de casa, quien se encarga de cuidar a sus hijos que cada día van creciendo, dos de ellos estudian en una escuela pública, para don Marvin no es fácil cubrir las necesidades  de sus hijos,  porque solamente él trabaja y sus ingresos como guarda de seguridad son muy bajos. A pesar de sus dificultades está intentando hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, con este crédito mejorara las condiciones de un cuarto para sus hijos.
texts.en: Marvin is married. He wife does the housework and takes care of their children, who are getting bigger each day. Two of their children attend a public school. It isn't easy for Marvin to pay for the things his children need because only he works, and his wage as a security guard is very low. Despite the challenges, he is trying to make improvements to his house. He will use this loan to renovate a room for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 38 años de edad, esta casada con Esteban quien es taxista, vive con su pareja y sus dos  menores hijos de 13 y 07 años de edad respectivamente,  tiene su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo de su esposo.El trabajo de Lucia consiste en la venta de refrescos y plátanos en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, ya tiene un promedio de 2 años en está actividad tiempo en el cual se ha hecho conocida en la zona, ésta  actividad lo realiza sola como siempre con mucho entusiasmo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, es  rentable, y le gusta socializarse.Este sería su préstamo número 04 con Kiva, está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para avanzar con su negocio.Con el préstamo de 1800 nuevos soles, comprara productos tales como  plátanos y frutas  para ampliar su negocio, buscando comprar en mayor volumen para si tener menores precios  y más acogida y mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Lucia is 38 years old. She is married to Esteban, who is a taxi driver. She lives with her spouse and two minor children, aged 13 and 7. She owns her own home which she bought with her husband's help. Lucia's job is selling juices and plantains at a stall located in her local market. She has been doing this activity for about 2 years and during that time she has become known in the area. She does this activity alone and she always does it with a lot of enthusiasm. What she likes about her job is it allows her to have some income that gives her the peace of mind of being to offer her children the best. It is profitable and she likes to socialize. This would be loan number 04 with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support that she is getting to advance in her business. With the loan of 1,800 nuevos soles, she will buy products such as plantains and fruit to expand her business, buying in larger quantities to have lower prices and more demand and better profits.

loans.use: to fruit and plantains wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
Edwin,de 31 años que se dedica a la carpintería desde hace algunos años Él dice que este oficio lo aprendió cuando comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven en talleres de carpintería le gustó mucho la idea de crear muebles se dio cuenta que era económicamente rentable y tomo la decisión de montar su taller con las pocas herramientas que pudo comprar con  sus ahorros. Desde que recibió el primer  crédito su  vida cambio en este momento ha aumentado su producción y tiene más clientes por eso tuvo la necesidad de hacer este nuevo crédito él está muy agradecido con MiCrédito y  Kiva por darle una mano para poder ir tecnificando más su taller con nuevas máquinas. Él dice  que su sueño es llegar a ser un gran empresario esa es una meta que se ha propuesto además de  tener un lugar donde exhibir sus muebles que son muy bonitos con un acabado especial  y finos.


Solicitó este crédito para comprar madera, playwood, clavos, lija, pegamento, pintura.
texts.en:
31-year-old Edwin has made a living from making furniture for several years. He says that he learnt this trade when he began working at a young age in carpentry workshops. He really liked the idea of making furniture. He realised that it was profitable and he made the decision of building his own workshop with the few tools that he could buy with his savings. 

Since he received the first loan his life has changed. His production has increased and he has more clients. For this reason he needed to get a new loan. He is very grateful to MiCrédito and Kiva for giving him a hand so he can continue making his workshop more technical by buying new machines. He says that his dream is to become a great businessman; this is a goal that he has set for himself, in addition to having a place where he can display his furniture, which is very beautiful and fine with a special finish.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy wood, plywood, nails, sandpaper, glue, and paint.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, nails, sandpaper, glue, and paint

loans.name: Blanca Daysi

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de pupusas. Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos los cuales están pequeños. El negocio  lo posee desde hace diez años por herencia de su madre, este está bien establecido y cuenta con una excelente clientela.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de inventario tales como: maíz, aceite, bebidas, condimentos, entre otros.  Esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su clientela, ofrecer mejor producto   y asimismo incluir almuerzos para algunos clientes. 
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y hacerla mas grande para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca sells pupusas. She lives with her husband and two children, who are small. She has had her business for ten years and she inherited it from her mother. It is well established and has an excellent clientele.

She will invest the loan in buying inventory such as: corn, oil, beverages, condiments and more. This purchase will help improve her clientele, offering a better product and lunches for some customers. Her dream is to improve her housing and make it bigger to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, beverages, condiments and more.

loans.name: Solidario Santa Rosita Group

texts.es:
Solidario santa Rosita
Este solidario lo integra Alicia, es originaria de Sumpango, y tiene un puesto de verduras en el mercado de la antigua Guatemala ella necesita un crédito mas para poder invertir nuevamente en su negocio ya que necesita surtirlo, es un poco triste ya que el año pasado falleció su cuñada y dos meses después falleció su mama, pero a pesar de eso sigue adelante con su negocio y ya terminaron de cancelar su credito y necesita que kiva les ayude por medio de otro crédito ya que cuentan que ha sido de mucha bendición para ellas y sus familias, ella solicita el credito para la compra de verdura para la venta.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the communal bank Solidario Santa Rosita and was born in Sumpango. She has a vegetable stand in the market in Antigua, Guatemala. She needs a loan to invest in her business, as she needs to buy inventory. She is a bit sad because her sister-in-law died last year, and two months later, her mother died. Despite that, she continues working and has paid off her loan. 

She is asking Kiva to help them by providing another loan, as the previous loan was of great help to the members and their families. Alicia has applied for a loan to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operador de máquinas numa empresa privada e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para fazer acabamentos na sua casa. 
No futuro deseja adquirir mais um terreno para construir outra casa para o futuro de seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é economizar mais o seu salário para poder pagar o empréstimo solicitado.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and the father of 3 children who go to School; he lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a machine operator at a private company. With this loan he plans to buy construction material (blocks, cement, sand, stone and others) to finish off his house.

In future he hopes to buy more land to build another house for his children's future. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to save up more of his salary to pay off this loan.

loans.use: buy construction material (blocks, cement, sand, stone and others) to finish off his house.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda and her husband are both farmers who live in a rural community. They were gifted with three children, and they want them to earn a degree so that they can find a good job someday. Due to financial constraints, they aimed to improve their farming business to earn a higher income. Rosalinda plans to engage in hog raising to generate additional income. She is asking for additional capital of P17,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and piglets to raise. 

She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and piglets to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a  forty-one-year-old married man. He is a pig farmer and has done this for eight years. His purpose is to use the loan to buy more pigs for breeding. His customers are major firms but also middlemen who connect them to selling areas. He faces the challenge of fluctuation of demand. Peter will use the anticipated profits to service the loan. He is persistent and sees his business having grown to a regional supplier of pigs in five years time. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs for breeding

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela  es originaria de Limay municipio de Estelí pero emigro con su familia a la ciudad   para mejorar se situación económica sus padres ya fallecieron y ella quedó con su hermana. Su hermana se casó pero Angelita decidió no casarse ya que se  dedicó a trabajar y conseguir para construir su casa lo cual lo logro  se preparó desde hace dos años puso su negocio de pulpería en su casa la cual ha salido todo un éxito empezó como un proyecto compró u poco de pan y café y la gente buscada otras cosas y ella las iba comprado poco a poco hasta tener una pulpería este ha sido su primer negocio, en el cual  la apoya su hermana a veces atendiendo la venta cuando ella sale hacer las comprar sólo tiene los ingresos de su negocio y dos cuartitos que alquila en su casa el crédito lo solicita para la compra de una vitrina para el negocio las ventas han crecido y debe exhibir los productos y para comprar arroz, azúcar aceite, maíz y otros productos sus metas próximas son comprar vitrinas y un freezer sus planes futuros son tener una miscelánea bien surtida de buenos productos comestibles.
texts.en: Ángela is from Limay, the town of Estelí, but she migrated with her family to the city to improve their financial situation. Her parents already passed away and she stayed with her sister. Her sister married but Angelita decided not to marry since she dedicated herself to working and get money to build her house. She was able to do this. She started preparing two years ago and opened her convenience store in her house. It has been a success. She tarted as a project, buying a little bread and coffee. People sought out other things and she would get them little by little until she had a store. This is her first business. Her sister helps her with it, sometimes tending the store when she goes out to do the buying. She only has the income from the store and from two rooms she rents out in her house. She is asking for the loan to buy a display case for her business. Sales have increased and she has to display the products. She will also buy rice, sugar, oil, corn and other products. Her next goals are to buy display cases and a freezer. Her future plans are to have a well stocked store with good edible products.

loans.use: to buy a display case, rice, sugar, oil, corn, etc.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El Sr. Felipe, está casado con la Sra. Maria hace 30 años, ambos trabajan en un vivero y viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque. Ellos son una pareja muy trabajadora, que le encanta lo que hace.
Con gran variedad de plantas para ofrecer a sus clientes, el y su esposa están saliendo adelante, ellos quieren crecer y es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo.
El préstamo que solicita Felipe lo invertirá para la compra de materiales para su trabajo como ser semilla, abono, media sombra, etc.y de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de plantas a sus clientes y seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Felipe has been married to Maria for 30 years. They both work in a nursery and live in their own house in the city of Luque. They are a hardworking couple and love what they do. With a great variety of plants to offer their customers, he and his wife are doing well. They want to grow their business, and they strive to meet this goal.

Felipe will use this loan to buy supplies for his work: seed, fertilizer, shading, etc. This way, he can offer his customers a bigger selection of plants and keep working.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, shading, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 50 years old and a very industrious mother of three children. She has a business where she sells cologne, powder, lotion, perfume and lipstick in their village. She uses the income she generates from her business carefully--for her business and for her children’s education. In order to increase her income, she is borrowing 13,000 PHP to buy additional products such as cologne, powder, lotion, perfume and lipstick. She hopes that she can get the amount that she has requested in order to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as cologne, powder, lotion, perfume and lipstick.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old, married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a general store in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over seven years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, rice and eggs. 

Esther plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, rice and eggs.

loans.name: Marquita

texts.es: Marquita, de 23 años de edad,vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 5 meses de nacido en su casa es propia.El trabajo de Marquita, consiste en la venta de comidas y bebidas,trabajo que realiza los fines de semana en un local ubicado en su hogar el cual lo abrió ya hace 05 años , en todo ese tiempo ha logrado hacerse conocida y tener una buena cantidad de clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un mejor ingreso económico, sigue esforzándose  gracias a que su puesto ya que es muy concurrido .Por tanto éste sería su primer préstamo con Kiva y comenta su agradecimiento por la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio.Con el préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para arreglar su negocio como calaminas y listones para arreglar el techado y tambien comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus parrilladas.
texts.en:
Marquita, 23 years old, lives in the company of her husband and her 5-month-old child in her own home.  Marquita’s work consists of the sale of food and drinks, work which she carries out on the weekends in a spot located in her home which she opened 5 years ago.  In all of that time she has managed to become well-known and to have a good amount of customers.  What she likes about her work is that it allows her to have a better economic income.  She continues to strive and  thanks to that her place is already well-frequented.  

So, this will be her first loan with Kiva and she comments on her appreciation for the opportunity to have a financial support in order to make progress with her business.  With the loan of 800 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy materials to fix up her business like corrugated metal roofing and wooden slats to fix the roof and also she will buy the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her barbecue.

loans.use: to fix the roof of her home and to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Miriam Laura

texts.es: Mirian Laura nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues su actividad económica es la venta de productos nutricionales pues es distribuidora mayorista. Ella también es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Challabamba. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos nutricionales o energeticos. Su sueño es comprarse un carro y construir una casa en la ciudad del Cusco. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Mirian Laura was born in the Challabamba district and still lives there today. The Challabamba district is located in the province of Paucatambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. Mirian Laura is 32 years old and has a common-law partner with whom she has two children. She belongs to the Virgen de Chanca communal bank. She is a responsible and enterprising woman whose primary job is selling nutritional products wholesale. She is also a teacher and works at one of the schools in Challabamba. At this point, she is requesting a loan to buy more nutritional and energy products. Her dream is to buy a car and build a house in Cusco. She is thankful to everyone for the loan and promises to punctually make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy more nutritional products

loans.name: Sumber Bunga Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become common to keep pigs at home to help support the family in addition to the husband's income. Apart from farming, they can help meet the needs of daily life by raising livestock, especially pigs. However, there are several obstacles in developing the business, including limited knowledge of business management and limited access to capital. To overcome these problems, the women pictured above decided to unite into one group so it would easier to communicate amongst themselves and obtain funding.

Wayan is head of the Sumber Bunga Group and runs a pig-breeding business. She has 3 children, 2 of whom work in the city. To increase her business, Wayan invited group members to participate in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. She will use her portion of the loan to buy three piglets and to buy feed. In 5 months, the pigs will be ready for sale. The income gained from this effort will be used entirely to support her family.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and to buy feed

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed products and this gave her a chance to have higher income. She is working hard to continuously provide income for her family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other products for her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narcisa hopes for a continuous growth in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other products for her business.

loans.name: Capistrana

texts.en: Capistrana is a 34-year-old married woman from Talibon, in the province of Bohol. She has 3 children, the youngest of whom is 7 and the oldest of whom is 13. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for almost 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and more rice seedlings so she can increase her harvest and sales. In the future, Capistrana would like to invest in another business to improve her family's livelihood and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more rice seedlings

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en: Antonieto is a 46-year-old married man and a father of five children. The family lives in Dauis, in the province of Bohol. Antonieto has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 15 years. This has been his source of income. He is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business so it is successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, who is separated, is 41 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Osamiz City. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the business as a way of generating extra income and earns about 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 2 years.

Erlinda just recently became a member of GDMPC. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP and intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. In the future, she wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Kitebutura Friends Group

texts.en:
Musa is a hardworking married man with 3 children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is involved in a number of activities, including crop farming, poultry, and transportation, and also operates a hotel to support his family. As the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University and to set up sustainable income-generating activities so as to secure a good future for them. Poor roads and price fluctuations hinder his progress, but his dream is to become a model farmer.

Musa is requesting for a loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation and buy feed for his poultry project. He is a member of the Kitebutura Friends Group, where each member guarantees the others to access a loan.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation and buy feed for his poultry project.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
This is Mercedez. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, enabling her to buy needed spare parts for her tricycle. She also has a van that she rents for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs, and the earnings facilitated by the loan helped in the education of her children and in the family's household expenditures.

Mercedez would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. The profits from this business will definitely help her to meet the family's daily needs as well as support her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedez hopes to have another vehicle in the future and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 57 years old and is engaged in a poultry business. She has been in this business for 20 years. Myrna is married and blessed with three children. She raises her children through her business. Myrna needs additional funds to buy more chickens and ducks to raise. In this regard, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy chickens, ducks and feed for them. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, ducks and feed for them.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a twenty-five-year-old married woman with one child who lives in Kasese, Uganda. After realizing that her husband could not meet all of the family's needs with his wages as a casual laborer, she decided to set up a retail shop. Like everyone in the retail shop business, Juliet faces a challenge of price fluctuations. Her dream is to trade in wholesale. She intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt, soap, boxes of matches, sugar, and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, boxes of matches, sugar, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues su actividad económica es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, gaseosas, cervezas y otras cosas, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos a sus amigos y vecinos. Ella En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues le sale a mas barato. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Hilda was born in the district of Challabamba and still lives there today. The Challabamba district is located in the province of Paucatambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. Hilda is 35 years old and has a common-law partner with whom she has four children. She belongs to the Virgen de Chanca communal bank. She is a responsible and enterprising woman whose primary job is selling staple goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, bread, soda, beer and other items. She has a small shop in her home where she sells her products to friends and neighbors. At this point, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar wholesale because they are sold at a cheaper price. She is thankful to everyone for the loan and promises to punctually make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta nació en el distrito de Cusco pero ahora vive en el distrito de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. 

Maria Antonieta es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora vio que los gastos de la familia se incrementaba entonces necesitaba abrir un negocio y entonces con ayuda de su esposo creó un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos y entonces a medida que iba creciendo el negocio se da cuenta que necesita más capital entonces un grupo de vecinas le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” donde le prestaría dinero para comprar más mercadería hoy en día ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, colonias, aretes, cremas, pinta labios y otras cosas más. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta was born in Cusco and now lives in Challabamba (a town located in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Perú). She is 45 years old, married and has four children.  

Maria Antonieta is an entrepreneurial, hard working woman. She noticed her family's expenses were increasing and saw the need to start a business. With her husband's help, she started selling cosmetics. Her business started growing to the point where she needed more capital. That was when a group of neighbors invited her to be part of communal bank “Virgen de Chanca.” Today she is asking for a loan in order to purchase more cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, earrings, creams, lipsticks and others. She is grateful to her loaners and is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, earrings, creams, lipsticks and others.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 54 years old, and married with 7 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Cesar owns and operates a banana production business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 10 years and earns 5,000PHP every month. Cesar joined GDMPC in 2008, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Cesar's plan in the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old, and is engaged in buying and selling of fish in the village. She does it daily and earns an amount of PHP100-200 a day. Teresita uses this to buy their everyday needs such as rice, spices and viand. 

Now, Teresita is asking for a loan amount PHP13,000 to buy variety of fishes to offer. She hopes she could now earn higher than her usual income through the help of additional capital.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fishes to offer to her customers

loans.name: Ericka Rosa

texts.es: Doña Erika, una señora trabajadora, madre soltera con 4 hijos, siendo uno de ellos de 17 años  con capacidad diferente, por lo que lo atiende en una escuela especial donde aveces le es difícil mantener todos los gastos principales del hogar ella sola, sus ingresos son las ventas de ropa usada, también se ayuda trabajando como empleada domestica, para logar equilibrar los gastos. Este segundo crédito lo destinara para levantar un muro en la parte frontal de su casa, ya que corre el riesgo de que le roben los pocos productos que tiene en venta desde su porche, porque la zona donde habita es peligrosa.
texts.en: Erika is a hardworking woman and a single mother of four children, one of them being 17 years old with special needs and therefore looked after in a special school, so sometimes it is difficult to keep up with all the main household expenses by herself.  Her income is from the sale of used clothing and also working as a housekeeper in order to manage to balance the expenses.  She intends to use this second loan to raise a wall in the front part of her house since she runs the risk of being robbed of the few products that she has for sale on her porch, because the area where she lives is dangerous.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar and cinder blocks to build a front wall.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is engaged in a street food selling business. She usually sell "kikyam", fish balls, "kwek-kwek" and hot-dogs in her village using her bicycle. She has been in this business for almost three years. 

Rosalina needs additional capital for her business. In this regard, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 to buy raw ingredients such as flour, eggs, fish balls and sticks. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested in order to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as flour, eggs, fish balls and sticks

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 27 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues su actividad económica es la venta de productos hechos de plásticos como tazas, bolsas, platos y otras, ella también vende frutas como manzanas, duraznos pues en la zona Challabamba se siembra en grandes cantidades. Ya es un año que tiene en negocio pues le muy excelente. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo manzanas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Maribel was born in the Challabamba district and lives in the same area where she was born. (The Challabamba district is located in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco in Peru). She is 27 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has two children. She is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Chanca" and is a responsible and enterprising person who sells products made from plastic such as cups, bags, plates etc. She also sells fruits like apples and peaches because there are many of these fruits growing in the Challambamba area. She has been running this business for a year now and it is going very well. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, for example apples, to sell. She is grateful to the lenders for this loan and pledges to make punctual repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell, for example, apples.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues sus actividades económicas son la venta de fruta, ganadería y agricultura, ella vende frutas de las cuales las más populares que crecen en grandes cantidades por la zona Challabamba son las manzanas y los duraznos. Ya es un año que tiene en negocio pues le muy excelente. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas por ejemplo manzanas. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Sebastiana was born in the Challambamba district and lives in the same area in which she was born, (Challambamba is located in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco in Peru.) She is 30 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. She is a member of the "Virgen de Chalca" communal bank. She is a responsible and enterprising person and works selling fruit, livestock, and does agricultural work. She sells the most popular fruits that grow in abundance in the area. These are apples and peaches. She has been doing this for a year and it is going well. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits such as apples. She is grateful to the lenders for the loan and pledges to make punctual repayments.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as apples to sell.

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.en:
Zakhir is 38 years old.  He lives in Marneuli District with his 30-year-old wife, retired parents, and two children (10 and 6 years old).  Zakhir requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, without success.  His loan request was always rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Zakhir’s parents.  Their income is so small that it’s hardly enough for food. 

Zakhir has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the rural poor, as they do not have access to credit products.  These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.  

With his credit, Zakhir will purchase fruits and vegetables.  He will rent a small counter at the local market and purchase products from the villages at the wholesale price.  He will sell from his counter at a higher price and earn a good profit.  Part of the profit will be used to purchase inventory in order to expand the business.  Additional profit will be used to cover the family’s living expenses.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en:
Marijen is a vendor from Dauis, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Marijen is asking for a loan to buy more coolers for fish and to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her fish vending business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more coolers for fish and to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ariane

texts.en:
Ariane is 27 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental and owns and operates a retail business selling items such as general merchandise to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns 10,000PHP every month. 

Ariane joined GDMPC last year, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000PHP to purchase additional materials for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 47 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 2 children, the youngest child is 16 while the oldest is 17. 

Rolando grows rice. He has been growing rice for almost 10 years. In order to continue and to be able to survive his farming, Rolando requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labourers. 

In the future, Rolando would like to expand his farming business to support his family as well as to finance his children to obtain a college education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labourers

loans.name: Sari Ayu Group

texts.en: The Sari Ayu group requests an additional loan of the same size to increase their business.  The group received 7.5M IDR, with each member receiving 1.5M IDR.  Ni Luh will use her loan to purchase piglets, feed, and to renovate the cage.  She now has 2 sows and hopes they can give birth again.  She hopes the planning will go well and she can be a piglet-seller in her village.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to renovate the cage.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel buys and sells different fish.  She has been doing this patiently for the past six years and dreams to experience a better living.  To achieve her dream effortlessly, she is asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy different fish, such as milkfish, to sell.  These particular fish are in demand.  She hopes that she could achieve her dream soon through the loan and working tirelessly.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is an ambitious married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an agriculturalist, but also sells milk to meet the daily expenses of his family. Richard has been in business for eight years and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children.

Richard's personal goal is to build a permanent house for residence while business goal is to own a dairy farm and modernize his farming activities. Richard intends to use the loan to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Tiffany

texts.en:
As a young girl, Tiffany used to beg her parents to let her dress herself. She hated to match, loved wearing bright colors, and always appreciated the compliments she would receive for standing out.

When Tiffany began her MBA program years later, she discovered a passion to pursue her love of fashion further. After creating a business plan and designing her first line of custom-designed hats, Tiffany’s idea and love for fashion had turned into a business, "Ellie Hayes".

As the owner of a start-up business and an MBA student, Tiffany balances the demands of both without complaint. She views starting her own business as an opportunity to achieve her dreams and give back. A percentage of each cap sold is donated to Clinics of Hope, a World Help organization committed to building medical clinics within villages and providing access to life-saving medical care. By donating to Clinics of Hope, Tiffany’s business will be helping villages in sub-Sahara Africa build a stronger tomorrow.

What Tiffany loves about owning her own company is the satisfaction and joy that comes from seeing a customer find confidence and individuality while wearing her product. She hopes that through her product people will feel stylish while knowing their purchase helped to give back.

With your help, Tiffany can fund the manufacturing cost of the hats and build an online website for information and sales.

loans.use: to fund manufacturing and website costs for her hat business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 8 years. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs. She will use the loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "harvesting farm produce". Her biggest challenge is "not enough well developed markets locally".

Alice (pictured with her dairy cow though requesting a poultry loan) was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It has grace period.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Important for our economy.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Alice replied 'Improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alice owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Unu Nio Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30's, is married with four children, one son and three daughters, and all of them go to school. She has been running two businesses, as a food vendor and a poultry business. She works from 11.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restock the missing items in her food store, employed two girls for helping serving food, started a poultry business, bought new cooking equipments and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, covered household expenses and started building her house.  Mariam will use this loan to increase the food stock and to sell to more customers. Her dream is to own a nice car.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "UNU NIO" with 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more food stock to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and secure future projects

loans.name: Kitulano Group

texts.en:
Alex is a single man in his early 20’s with a young son.  He has been running a business selling shoes for two years.  He works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  This will be Alex's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy more shoes to resell.  His dream is to one day be able to own a wholesale shop and to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "KITULANO".  This group has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: Mrs. Terbish is 38 years old and lives with her only daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia.  Her husband passed away many years ago.  She has been working as a fuel distributor at a gas station since 2009.  She also receives a state pension because she is now the head of the household. The apartment she and her daughter live in has been deteriorating over the years and is in need of some serious repair and insulation.  So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase materials such as gypsum, cement, fiberglass, and foam.  Using these materials, she can repair and insulate her apartment, thus providing a comfortable and warm accommodation for her daughter.  Moreover, she will use less energy for heating due to the renovation.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for her apartment.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 53 year old married woman and a mother of 7 grown up children from Dauis, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fish vending business for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman, and this is the source of her income. 

Rufina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. Through this loan her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more fish needed in her business. The loan also helped with her household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. She also has a variety store.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to pay for dried fish she needs in her business. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items for her variety store. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gina dreams to have her own stall and hopes that her house will be renovated. She meets up with the other members of her fellowship* to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different kinds of fish and grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Jig

texts.en: Jig is 32 years old and single. He lives in the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for 5 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC last year, and now he has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Jabu

texts.en:
Jabu is a widow and mother of nine children. Three of them still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. A major challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

Jabu is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ivtisam

texts.en:
Ivtisam has provided sewing and alteration services for many years along with knitting items. She has become known for her own designs and excellent work. Recently, she began working adjacent to a bridal salon and is expanding her business. She provides additions and decorative pieces to formal and bridal wear, sells some of her own pieces, and provides alterations for her customers. Although Ivtisam dropped out of school for personal reasons after 8th grade, over the years she has taught herself and gained much-appreciated skills. Many salons in the area are beginning to utilize her services.
Ivtisam needs this loan to purchase a specialized sewing machine, stands, shelving, and materials for sewing and knitting.
Ivtisam wants to continue to expand her business, meeting the ever-growing demand of her customers and area bridal boutiques. One day, she wants to open a shop where she will sell more of her own pieces and designs.

loans.use: to purchase a specialized sewing machine, stands, shelving, and materials for sewing and knitting.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is 38 years old. He lives in the Tetritskaro district with his mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Ilia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have pigs and sell piglets locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Ilia requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Ilia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high risk borrowers because of their low income. 

With his credit, Ilia will open a bakery. He will purchase a kneader for dough and all the needed equipment for starting bakery. This will increase the income of the family. Part of the income will be reinvested in the same business, and with another part he will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to start a bakery and purchase a kneader for dough.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Juanito is 40 years old. He is married and has one child. He lives in the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province. He owns and operates a food vending business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase additional snacks to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional snacks to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Jubie

texts.en:
Ma. Jubie is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of 8 children from Loon, Bohol. Ma. Jubie has been engaged in fish vending for more than 9 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman and a carpenter. 

Ma. Jubie is asking for loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Ma. Jubie hopes to make her business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely and her husband aimed to improve their standard of living, in order to satisfy their needs and educate their four children. They live happily in a rural community, working in agriculture, planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops to sell.

Due to the hardships of living, Emely decided to engage also in hog-raising, to generate additional income. To help start the business, she is asking to borrow additional capital of 18,000 PHP. She will use it to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve the business, and she is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a Ugandan woman aged 40, who lives in Fort Portal and has three children. She deals in produce, but is also a credit officer who works with a microfinance institution. She has dreams of educating her children to attain degrees, as a minimum qualification. She also wants to set up a large food store that can supply the region all year round. Price fluctuations and limited time to run the business affect her profit margin, since her job is so demanding, but her plan is to resign and concentrate on her business after it has broken even. Sarah intends to use the loan to buy produce, such as maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy produce, such as maize and beans.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Hard work and patience has been Cynthia's guiding principle in running her livestock business. Cynthia has been a hog raiser for almost four years. Aside from hog raising, she also engaged in a direct selling business, particularly AVON, as her additional source of income.

Cynthia would like to take out a loan of PHP10,000. She will be using this amount to buy livestock feed and three piglets. She hopes to keep her livestock business productive and profitable someday. Cynthia is 45 years of age, married and has four children. Her four children currently go to school so she needs to increase the income she generates from her livestock and direct selling for her to earn greater income. 

She knows that this loan will really help her most especially in ensuring her hogs have proper nutrition upon reaching their maturity period. This loan will also help her in educating her four children.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and hog feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Heda

texts.en:
This is Heda. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for her tricycle unit. She also used the previous funds for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings helped to provide an education for her children while also assisting in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and provide maintenance for her tricycle unit. The profits from her business will help her to sustain the daily needs of her family and provide an education for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Heda hopes that her business will continue to grow so she can continue to help her children in their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle unit

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña rory está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas luchan por sus familias para poder darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Basilia, ella realiza manualidades, también se debe destacar que hace todo tipo de artículos para la venta, y que con ese esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante.
La Sra. Basilia  Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para realizar sus artesanías, como ser telas, hilos, pinturas, etc, lo que le ayudará a seguir con lo que está haciendo y dando lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: The Kuña Rory group is requesting its 12th loan from the women's committee where they all work and help each other to move forward. They work hard to give their families everything they need, so that they never have to go without. One of the members, Basilia, makes handicrafts and many other items to sell, and due to her efforts, she is doing well and gives her family everything they need so that they too can move forward. Basilia is requesting this loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her handicrafts such as fabric, sewing thread, paints, etc. which will help her to carry on with her work and give the best products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sewing thread, paints, etc to make traditional crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper to be processed into powder for sale.

loans.name: Vaghinak

texts.en:
Vaghinak is 48 years old and comes from Akhalkalaki District. He has a large family: parents, brother, sister-in-law, nephew and niece. Vaghinak requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays, the family is out of sources of income, except for the retirement pensions of Vaghinak’s parents. The pensions total 250 Laris (GEL) per month. It is hardly enough for food, for the seven-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Vaghinak requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Vaghinak has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to ordinary credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Vaghinak will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan is 41 years old. He lives in Keda district with his 38-year-old wife, two children, and son in-law. 

Aslan requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Aslan had a mini-bus. He was working in Batumi district on the bus-line to earn a small monthly income for the family. Aslan requested loan from Credo to re-start the family business. Aslan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Aslan will purchase a mini-bus. He has some savings and needs a loan to add to them and buy a better bus then he had before. As he is very experienced in this field and was already working as a driver, Aslan thinks he can bring in a good income with his new mini-bus in the family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn to sell to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 27 years old, married, and a mother of two children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her grocery store in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about 10,300 KES from the business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, onions, and so on to sell to her customers.

Naomi will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, as well as continue expanding the business. Naomi's goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her business such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a single mother of five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling chapatti and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shilling from MCDTSACCO to buy more jerry cans of cooking oil and baking flour. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring employing some other two girls to assist in baking and frying chapatti, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more jerry cans of cooking oil and baking flour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For over ten years, Fatuma has operated an open food business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. Potential customers include neighbors and other members of her community. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan she is requesting, Fatuma will purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for her business. 

Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites runs a sari-sari (variety store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area -- Loon, Bohol. Marites is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries and items to resell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, beverages, soap and shampoo. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: buy additional groceries and items to resell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, beverages, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is an industrious and loving mother. Her spouse is a farmer, and she helps him to manage the rice field they own. Marissa sells the harvested crop to traders in their village and earns about 15,000 PHP twice a year, during harvest season. She spent it wisely to maintain a productive harvest and to pay the education fees of her children.
Marissa is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. They will help nourish the crops and will enable a fruitful harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a responsible mother who is engaged in the hog-raising business to support her husband in generating income. She is now 58 years old and has a child. She aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Due to financial difficulty, Virginia is asking for an additional capital of 18,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able improve the business as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Nancy is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Aburaman Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Nancy is married and has one child. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their child’s school fees. 

Nancy wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Nancy plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
This is Luisa. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a computer shop for another source of income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luisa hopes for continuous growth in her business and dreams of sending her grandchildren to a good school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a Kiva borrower. Her husband passed away. Margaret has one child. She has been running a fast food cafe for six years. The business is located in a highly populated area, where her customers come from. She faces a challenge of needing capital to expand her business.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase food ingredients, for preparing meals to sell. She intends to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand the business. This is the client's second loan with SMEP DTM. Her future goals are to expand her business and be successful. The client is business-oriented.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Vernecita

texts.en:
Vernecita is a 25-year-old married mother from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has a 3-year-old daughter. 

Vernecita is engaged in the hog-raising business, and has been doing this for 3 years. Her husband works as a welder in a shop located in their community. His income is not enough to sustain her business. 

Vernecita  requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements so that her pigs are raised healthy. In the future, she would like to expand her business to provide more support for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Mwanamaya

texts.en:
Mwanamaya is a single mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.
For over twenty years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.
With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old. He is married to Gladys and is the father of six children. He is a hawker of soft tissues and wet wipes. He has been in this business for three years now and gets monthly income of 17,000 KES.
This will be Peter’s second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy soft tissues and wet wipes to sell. In the future, he wants to be a prosperous businessman and also to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy soft tissues and wet wipes to sell.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold is 49 years old and lives with his son, sibling, and half nephew in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.
